qas.question: Marvel Comics was part of many entities having what relationship with Timely?
When were all of Goodman's comic entities officially put under the moniker of Marvel Comics?
By what other name were some Marvel-related comic books published?

When did Goodman begin partnering with shell companies?
What were the biggest danger to Goodman's business strategy?

When was the first Marvel Mystery Comic published?

context: Goodman's business strategy involved having his various magazines and comic books published by a number of corporations all operating out of the same office and with the same staff. One of these <a0_0><b5_0>shell companies<b5_0/><a0_0/> through which Timely Comics was published was named Marvel Comics by at least <a3_0>Marvel Mystery Comics<a3_0/> #55 (<b7_0>May 1944<b7_0/>). As well, some comics' covers, such as <b8_0>All Surprise Comics<b8_0/> #12 (Winter <b6_0>1946<b6_0/>–47), were labeled <a2_0>"A Marvel Magazine"<a2_0/> many years before Goodman would formally adopt the name in <a1_0><b4_0>1961<b4_0/><a1_0/>.
